clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Patients With Trophic Ulcers Using Mesenchymal Stem Cells
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Patients With Trophic Ulcers Using Autologous Adipose-derived Mesenchymal Stem Cells

lead_sponsor.agency: Institute of Biophysics and Cell Engineering of National Academy of Sciences of Belarus

clinical_study.source: Institute of Biophysics and Cell Engineering of National Academy of Sciences of Belarus

brief_summary.textblock: Treatment of patients with trophic ulcers using injection of autologous adipose-derived mesenchymal stem cells around and inside the wound

detailed_description.textblock:
During the implementation of the project, it was planned to develop a method for the treatment of trophic ulcers using injection of autologous adipose-derived mesenchymal stem cells in the wound. The positive outlook for the effectiveness of MSCs is due to the following:
- the ability of MSCs to stimulate tissue regeneration
- positive results of preclinical studies of the method of treatment of trophic ulcers in animals (rats).
In study were included 18 patients (28 trophic ulcers treated). MSCs will be isolated from adipose tissue, cultured and then transplanted back to the wound. From 1 to 10 million MSCs in 4 ml were injected depending on the area of the wound. Follow up patients monitoring will occur at 1ï¼Œ2 and 3, 6, 12, 22 months after injection.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients with trophic ulcers received standard treatment and mesenchymal stem cells

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with tropic ulcers cured
Number of patients with treatment-related adverse events
primary_outcome.description: MSC injection related adverse events assessed by blood count and function tests

arm_group.description: Patients with trophic ulcers received standard treatment and MSC

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Trophic Ulcers
Exclusion Criteria:
- diagnosed cancer
- acute and chronic infectious diseases: HIV, viral hepatitis, tuberculosis
- mental disorders
- pregnancy

overall_official.affiliation: Head of the Lab of Institute of Biophysics and Cell Engineering
Head of 2 Department of Surgical Diseases of BSMU

facility.name: Institute of Biophysics and Cell Engineering of National Academy of Sciences of Belarus
